back_cards.definition_en: The center of attention or activity.
back_cards.example_en: The focus of the meeting was teamwork.

back_cards.definition_en: A state of clear mental concentration.
back_cards.example_en: She lost her focus during the long lecture.

back_cards.definition_en: The main point or emphasis.
back_cards.example_en: The article’s focus was environmental issues.

back_cards.definition_en: A point of convergence, as in optics.
back_cards.example_en: The camera’s focus was adjusted for clarity.

back_cards.definition_en: A goal or priority in a context.
back_cards.example_en: Her focus this year is improving skills.

back_cards.definition_en: Relating to the office of a president.
back_cards.example_en: The presidential election happens every four years.

back_cards.definition_en: Having the qualities of a president.
back_cards.example_en: She gave a presidential speech to the crowd.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to a president’s actions or duties.
back_cards.example_en: The presidential decision impacted the nation.

back_cards.definition_en: Associated with a president’s authority.
back_cards.example_en: The presidential suite was luxurious.

back_cards.definition_en: Involving the leadership of a president.
back_cards.example_en: His presidential campaign gained momentum.

back_cards.definition_en: To control or manage a machine or system.
back_cards.example_en: He learned to operate the new software.

back_cards.definition_en: To perform a function or work.
back_cards.example_en: The factory operates 24 hours a day.

back_cards.definition_en: To conduct a surgical procedure.
back_cards.example_en: The surgeon will operate on her knee.

back_cards.definition_en: To carry out a business or activity.
back_cards.example_en: They operate a small café downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: To function effectively in a role.
back_cards.example_en: She operates well under pressure.

back_cards.definition_en: An exclamation of frustration or anger.
back_cards.example_en: Fuck, I forgot my keys again!

back_cards.definition_en: A term to express strong disbelief.
back_cards.example_en: Fuck, did that really just happen?

back_cards.definition_en: A vulgar emphasis in casual speech.
back_cards.example_en: It’s cold as fuck outside today.

back_cards.definition_en: A word to convey intense emotion.
back_cards.example_en: Fuck, that was a close call!

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of irritation or surprise.
back_cards.example_en: Fuck, the train is late again.

back_cards.definition_en: A sight or scene from a particular position.
back_cards.example_en: The hotel room had a beautiful ocean view.

back_cards.definition_en: An opinion or perspective on something.
back_cards.example_en: Her view on the policy was clear.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of looking or observing.
back_cards.example_en: The view of the painting was stunning.

back_cards.definition_en: A way of considering a subject.
back_cards.example_en: He took a long-term view of the project.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual display or presentation.
back_cards.example_en: The slideshow gave a clear view of the data.

back_cards.definition_en: Happening or done every day.
back_cards.example_en: She reads the daily news each morning.

back_cards.definition_en: Related to a single day’s activities.
back_cards.example_en: His daily routine includes a morning jog.

back_cards.definition_en: Regular or routine in occurrence.
back_cards.example_en: The store receives daily deliveries.

back_cards.definition_en: Pertaining to everyday life.
back_cards.example_en: Daily tasks kept her busy at home.

back_cards.definition_en: Published or produced each day.
back_cards.example_en: The daily newspaper covers local events.

back_cards.definition_en: A place where goods are sold.
back_cards.example_en: She visited the shop to buy groceries.

back_cards.definition_en: A small retail or specialty store.
back_cards.example_en: The coffee shop was cozy and inviting.

back_cards.definition_en: A place for making or repairing things.
back_cards.example_en: The mechanic worked in an auto shop.

back_cards.definition_en: A setting for buying specific items.
back_cards.example_en: The gift shop had unique souvenirs.

back_cards.definition_en: A workshop or workplace for crafts.
back_cards.example_en: He built furniture in his wood shop.

back_cards.definition_en: At a higher level or position than.
back_cards.example_en: The plane flew above the clouds.

back_cards.definition_en: More than a certain amount or value.
back_cards.example_en: The temperature rose above 80 degrees.

back_cards.definition_en: In a higher rank or authority.
back_cards.example_en: She reports to the manager above her.

back_cards.definition_en: Beyond or not subject to.
back_cards.example_en: He considered himself above petty arguments.

back_cards.definition_en: Earlier in a document or text.
back_cards.example_en: See the section above for details.

back_cards.definition_en: The act of separating into parts.
back_cards.example_en: The division of tasks made work easier.

back_cards.definition_en: A section or department of an organization.
back_cards.example_en: She works in the marketing division.

back_cards.definition_en: A disagreement or difference of opinion.
back_cards.example_en: The issue caused a division among friends.

back_cards.definition_en: A mathematical operation of dividing.
back_cards.example_en: The division of 12 by 3 is 4.

back_cards.definition_en: A group or category in sports or competition.
back_cards.example_en: Their team won the first division.

back_cards.definition_en: At a slow pace or speed.
back_cards.example_en: She walked slowly through the park.

back_cards.definition_en: In a gradual or unhurried manner.
back_cards.example_en: The sun set slowly behind the mountain.

back_cards.definition_en: With deliberate or cautious movement.
back_cards.example_en: He spoke slowly to ensure clarity.

back_cards.definition_en: In a way that takes time to progress.
back_cards.example_en: The project is moving slowly but steadily.

back_cards.definition_en: With reduced speed or intensity.
back_cards.example_en: The car slowed down slowly at the turn.

back_cards.definition_en: Guidance or recommendations offered.
back_cards.example_en: She gave me advice about choosing a career.

back_cards.definition_en: A suggestion to solve a problem.
back_cards.example_en: His advice helped fix the issue.

back_cards.definition_en: Expert or professional counsel.
back_cards.example_en: The lawyer provided legal advice.

back_cards.definition_en: Information or tips for improvement.
back_cards.example_en: Her advice on cooking was invaluable.

back_cards.definition_en: An opinion on what to do.
back_cards.example_en: I followed her advice and felt better.

back_cards.definition_en: A response to a stimulus or situation.
back_cards.example_en: Her reaction to the news was surprise.

back_cards.definition_en: A chemical change or process.
back_cards.example_en: The reaction produced a bright light.

back_cards.definition_en: An emotional or instinctive response.
back_cards.example_en: His reaction to the joke was laughter.

back_cards.definition_en: A consequence or effect of an action.
back_cards.example_en: The policy sparked a strong public reaction.

back_cards.definition_en: An opposition or counteraction.
back_cards.example_en: The decision faced a negative reaction.

back_cards.definition_en: Physical harm or damage to the body.
back_cards.example_en: He recovered from a knee injury.

back_cards.definition_en: A specific wound or trauma.
back_cards.example_en: The injury required stitches and rest.

back_cards.definition_en: Harm caused by an event or accident.
back_cards.example_en: The crash caused multiple injuries.

back_cards.definition_en: A figurative harm to reputation or feelings.
back_cards.example_en: Her words caused an injury to his pride.

back_cards.definition_en: A medical condition from overuse.
back_cards.example_en: The athlete suffered a stress injury.

back_cards.definition_en: A pronoun referring to a thing or situation.
back_cards.example_en: I dropped the book, and it fell open.

back_cards.definition_en: Used to identify an object or idea.
back_cards.example_en: It was a sunny day yesterday.

back_cards.definition_en: A placeholder for a subject or object.
back_cards.example_en: It seems like rain is coming.

back_cards.definition_en: Referring to an animal or inanimate thing.
back_cards.example_en: The dog wagged its tail happily.

back_cards.definition_en: Used in expressions of time or weather.
back_cards.example_en: It’s getting late, we should go.

back_cards.definition_en: A piece of paper granting entry or travel.
back_cards.example_en: She bought a ticket for the concert.

back_cards.definition_en: A document for transportation.
back_cards.example_en: His train ticket was for the 5 PM ride.

back_cards.definition_en: A citation for a legal violation.
back_cards.example_en: He got a ticket for speeding.

back_cards.definition_en: A chance or opportunity for something.
back_cards.example_en: This job is his ticket to success.

back_cards.definition_en: A label or tag with information.
back_cards.example_en: The ticket on the shirt showed the price.

back_cards.definition_en: A mark indicating quality or performance.
back_cards.example_en: She received an A grade on her test.

back_cards.definition_en: A level or year in school.
back_cards.example_en: He’s in the fifth grade this year.

back_cards.definition_en: A category or level of quality.
back_cards.example_en: They used high-grade materials for construction.

back_cards.definition_en: The slope or incline of a surface.
back_cards.example_en: The road has a steep grade uphill.

back_cards.definition_en: A classification or ranking.
back_cards.example_en: This beef is of prime grade.

back_cards.definition_en: An expression of surprise or admiration.
back_cards.example_en: Wow, that sunset is breathtaking!

back_cards.definition_en: A reaction to something impressive.
back_cards.example_en: Wow, you finished the project so fast!

back_cards.definition_en: Used to show excitement or enthusiasm.
back_cards.example_en: Wow, this concert is amazing!

back_cards.definition_en: A response to something unexpected.
back_cards.example_en: Wow, I didn’t see that coming!

back_cards.definition_en: An exclamation of delight or awe.
back_cards.example_en: Wow, look at that huge cake!

back_cards.definition_en: The act or process of being born.
back_cards.example_en: The birth of her child was a joyful moment.

back_cards.definition_en: The beginning or origin of something.
back_cards.example_en: The birth of the internet changed communication.

back_cards.definition_en: A person’s ancestry or lineage.
back_cards.example_en: She is of Italian birth.

back_cards.definition_en: The event of bringing forth life.
back_cards.example_en: The hospital recorded 50 births this month.

back_cards.definition_en: A starting point for an idea or movement.
back_cards.example_en: The protest marked the birth of a movement.

back_cards.definition_en: A work of art created with paint.
back_cards.example_en: Her painting hung in the gallery.

back_cards.definition_en: The act or process of applying paint.
back_cards.example_en: Painting the house took all weekend.

back_cards.definition_en: A visual representation on a surface.
back_cards.example_en: The painting captured the beauty of nature.

back_cards.definition_en: A creative expression through colors.
back_cards.example_en: His painting reflected his emotions.

back_cards.definition_en: A decorative coating for walls or objects.
back_cards.example_en: The room needed a fresh painting.

back_cards.definition_en: The result or consequence of an action.
back_cards.example_en: The outcome of the meeting was positive.

back_cards.definition_en: The final effect of a process.
back_cards.example_en: The experiment’s outcome surprised the team.

back_cards.definition_en: A resolution or conclusion.
back_cards.example_en: The trial’s outcome was a fair verdict.

back_cards.definition_en: The product of a decision or event.
back_cards.example_en: The policy’s outcome impacted the economy.

back_cards.definition_en: A future state based on current actions.
back_cards.example_en: They hoped for a successful outcome.
